FAQ

Got questions? We’ve got answers!

Booking Classes

Online registration is mandatory!
Each class has a size (participation) limit to encourage adequate spacing and to ensure you leave with a fulfilling workout experience.

We have a strict 24-hour cancellation policy for all classes. If you can no longer make a class, even if it's within the 24 hours, please do let us know as there is always a chance that someone on the waitlist can take your spot. In that case your class would be credited back to your account.

We do not have a age limit.

So feel free to join and be the best you.

We do however ask that you should you have any ailments or medical conditions (whether or not you think its concerning) that you declare these on your registration form wholly. This helps our instructors to modify their lesson plans and ensure your experience is comfortably challenging.

Of course! Our studio is open to EVERYONE no matter your gender or how you identify.

Attending Classes

No you don't.

Props/gears are available for every session that requires them.

​BUT! We understand for personal and hygienic reasons you may prefer to bring and use your own props/gears and we certainly have no objections.

Firstly, we're a wellness center, not a traditional gym.

That means we do not use machines, equipment and/or heavy weights. We promote the use of your own body weight, strength and flexibility to your advance your fitness level and overall wellness.

We recommend spacing out the sessions you want to attend - for example, one session a day or one session every other day - depending how inactive you've been and then gradually increase the frequency of your attendance.

Not at all!

Flexibility and strength is developed with consistent attendance as well as incorporating our "non-pole" sessions into your routine.
​
Fun fact: self-proclaimed "couch potatoes" have demonstrated having a better experience generally than the self-proclaimed "gym rat" in our pole sessions.

Skin contact with the pole is super important!

Our recommended attire is a sports bra/tank top and short shorts/biker tights

Heels, shoes and socks are only required for specific pole classes. So please double-check the class description to be preapred

Skin contact with the pole is super important!

Try to avoid using body lotions, oils, creams and moisturizers before attending a pole session. The "slippery-er" you are, the harder and more challenging your experience will be.
